page.title: 03FARMING continued
page.content: Artificial fertilisers are used to maintain high yields.{Grazing }About half the acreage of farmland is rough grazing(permanent pasture),improved hill-pasture and reclaimed land.{ {Livestock}The farm has 137 Autumn and 34 Spring calving cross cows.Highland cows are used for cross breeding with Charolais and Aberdeen Angus bulls to combine hardiness with good meat production.Bullocks are sold in Perth at one year old weighing 300-400kgs. Only 30 sheep are kept because they often suffer worst in the blizzards of winter.{Deer Farming}Since 1983, 150 red deer hinds have been enclosed on 250 acres of hill grazing.The calves are being used to build up a domestic herd.Shooting and venison production are managed by a stalker by agreement with the Nature Conservency,to maintain a stable population.
